Who is Ruben Studdard?

Ruben Studdard was born in Frankfurt, West Germany, on September 12, 1978, and raised in Birmingham, Alabama. He is an American singer and actor. His father, Kevin, a former autobody collision technology teacher, was stationed in Germany with the US Army at the time of his birth. His mother, Emily, teaches in the Birmingham school system.

Ruben’s liking for music began at a young age after listening to his mother’s Donny Hathaway albums, gospel music and Fred Hammond. He then chose to pursue a career in the music industry by majoring in voice studies at Alabama A&M University.

Ruben Studdard's music career

Ruben Studdard became famous for winning American Idol season 2 in 2003. That same year, he also got a Grammy Award nomination for Best R&B Vocal Performance for his Superstar recording.

Since then, Ruben Studdard went on to release seven top and platinum-selling albums, including Soulful (2003), I Need an Angel (2004), The Return (2006), Love Is (2009), Letters from Birmingham (2012), Unconditional Love (2014), and Ruben Sings Luther (2018).

Ruben Studdard's acting career

Ruben Studdard has acted in several major roles, including on the TV series Eve, All of Us, Life on a Stick, One on One, and 8 Simple Rules, as well as a cameo appearance in the blockbuster film Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed.

In addition, Studdard, alongside fellow American Idol alum Trenyce and Frenchie Davis, headlined the Ain’t Misbehavin’ revival tour.

What is Ruben Studdard doing now?

In 2015, Ruben Studdard received an honorary Master of Arts degree from Alabama A&M University. In 2022, Studdard taught two master classes for performing arts majors at the University of Tennessee, Chattanooga.

Studdard runs The Ruben Studdard Foundation for the Advancement of Children in the Music Arts, which helps talented children to better their musical skills. In addition, he is the official spokesman for Be Sickle Smart a program that pushes iron overload awareness among people living with sickle-cell disease.

How much is Ruben Studdard worth?

According to Celebrity Net Worth and The Richest, Ruben Studdard's net worth is allegedly $3 million. He has built this substantial net worth from his successful music career. Ruben has also worked as an actor in several TV series, including 8 Simple Rules, All of Us and more.

How much did Ruben Studdard win on American Idol?

Ruben Studdard earned bragging rights and a recording contract reportedly worth $1 million. He bested Clay Aiken by only 134,000 votes out of 24,000,000 cast in the May 2003 finale, making him the second American Idol winner. About 38.1 million viewers watched the finale episode.

Ruben Studdard's romantic relationships

Ruben met his former wife, Surata Zuri McCants, in October 2006 while signing CDs at a Walmart in Atlanta. They officially wedded in June 2008 in a private luxurious ceremony in Mountain Brook, Alabama. In November 2011, his attorney announced their separation, and they finalised their divorce in April 2012.

In June 2018, Studdard married Kristin Moore and they share a son (name undisclosed), born in 2020.
